entry.title: How to install SU2 in MPI mode on Linux

link.title: How to install SU2 in MPI mode on Linux

entry.content:
Pre-requisite installations installations

  1. Install swig

     sudo yum install swig

  2. Install MPICH

  3. Install MPI for Python (mpi4py)

  4. It is not needed to install Meson, Ninja, CoDiPack and MeDiPack. SU2 installation process does that for you and ensures the correct versions.

Installation

  1. Make sure you are using bash.

     echo $SHELL
 # if it is not bash, command: bash

  2. Create a folder for mpich

     mkdir /home/you/su2

  3. Download to that folder the latest stable source code version of su2 from: https://su2code.github.io/download.html

  4. Unzip the file

     unzip su2code...zip

  5. Create 2 other folders

     mkdir /home/you/su2/build

  6. Enter the unziped su2 source code folder and run mason

     ./meson.py build -Denable-autodiff=true --prefix=/home/you/su2/build
 cd /home/you/su2/su2code...

  7. Compile with ninja

     ./ninja -C build install

Learn more

Install on Windows

entry.summary: SU2 is a renowned CFD solver developed as an open-source code, in an initiative of the Stanford University. This tutorial guides the user through the process of installing SU2 in MPI mode in their windows or linux machines.

entry.title: How to install MPICH
entry.content:
1. Make sure you are using bash.

     echo $SHELL

  2. Create a folder for mpich

     mkdir /home/you/mpich
 # If it is not bash, command: bash

  3. Download to that folder the latest stable version of mpich from: https://www.mpich.org/downloads/

  4. Unpack the tar file that you just downloaded, mpich-x-y-z.tar.gz, where x-y-z is the version

     tar xfz mpich-x-y-z.tar.gz

  5. Create 2 other folders

     mkdir /home/you/mpich/build
 mkdir /home/you/mpich/mpich-install

  6. Enter the build directory and run the configuration script.

     cd /home/you/mpich/build ../mpich-x-y-z/configure --with-device=ch4:ofi -prefix=/home/you/mpich/mpich-install 2>&1 | tee c.txt

  7. Build mpich. Run command and go for a coffee:

     make 2>&1 | tee m.txt

  8. Install MPICH.

     make install 2>&1 | tee mi.txt

  9. Add the bin subdirectory of the installation directory to your path:

     export PATH=/home/you/mpich/mpich-install/bin:$PATH

  10. Check if the installation went well:

    which mpicc
which mpiexec

  11. Test mpi in your machine by using the example file that the building process creates. That simple program computes the value of PI. If your machine has NC cores, then:

    mpiexe -n NC ./examples/cpi

Learn more

entry.summary: Many software use MPICH as part of their parallel processes, including SU2. This tutorial guides the user through the process of installing MPICH in their windows or linux machines.

entry.title: How to install mpi4py
entry.content:
MPI for Python enables MPI usage for the Python language, allowing programmers to write codes that leverage multiple processor computing systems.

  1. In a bash terminal, sudo your user:

    sudo su

  2. Make sure you have Python 3 developer installed:

    yum install python3-devel

  3. If you donâ€™t have pip installed, install it with:

    easy_install pip

  4. Finally, install mpi4py.

    pip3 install mpi4py
